intro: Galium bungoniense, commonly known as Bungoni bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of tiny white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium bungoniense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
